See also: pass, Paß, and pass.

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • Paß (unofficial)

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /pas/
  • Audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -as

Noun[edit]

Pass m (genitive Passes, plural Pässe)

  1. pass (between mountains)
  2. pass (document granting permission to pass)
  3. passport

Declension[edit]

Declension of Pass

Luxembourgish[edit]

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /pɑs/
    Rhymes: -ɑs

Etymology 1[edit]

Noun[edit]

Pass m (plural Päss)

  1. pass (permission or license to pass)
  2. passport
  3. pass (road, e.g. a mountain pass)
Synonyms[edit]
  • (road): Col

Etymology 2[edit]

Borrowed from French passe.

Noun[edit]

Pass f (plural Passen)

  1. (sports) pass
